# OllaManager

> Free, open-source web dashboard to manage your local Ollama AI models.

## What is OllaManager?

OllaManager is a browser-based dashboard that connects to your local Ollama instance. It provides a visual interface to:

- **Dashboard**: View installed models, running models, disk usage, and VRAM stats
- **Models Library**: Pull (download) new models, search installed models, delete models
- **Chat**: Interactive chat with any installed model using streaming responses
- **Model Details**: View model family, parameters, quantization, template, and license
- **Settings**: Configure your Ollama server URL with a guided CORS setup

## How to Use

1. Visit the hosted version at the website URL
2. Install Ollama from https://ollama.com/download
3. Start Ollama with CORS enabled (see Settings page for OS-specific commands)
4. Connect and start managing your models

## Supported Models

Works with all Ollama models including: Llama 3, Gemma, Mistral, Qwen, Phi, DeepSeek, CodeLlama, and any model available in the Ollama registry.

## Tech Stack

- Vite + vanilla JavaScript (no framework)
- Vanilla CSS with dark theme and glassmorphism
- Direct fetch() calls to local Ollama REST API
- No backend server required â€” runs entirely in the browser

## License

Open source. Free to use.
